meanings.definition: A soft leather cloth used for polishing.
meanings.sent1: I used a chammy to clean my car.
meanings.sent2: The chammy made the table shine.
meanings.sent3: The chammy danced across the surface, leaving it sparkling.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved like a chammy, smoothing out all the imperfections.
meanings.sent5: The chammy felt like a gentle cloud against the glass.

meanings.sent1: I will chammy the windows to make them clear.
meanings.sent2: She chammyed the silverware until it gleamed.
meanings.sent3: He chammyed so fast, it looked like magic.
meanings.sent4: The car gleamed as if chammyed by fairies.
meanings.sent5: Chammying the mirror made her reflection crystal clear.

meanings.definition: A type of leather made from the skin of the chamois.
meanings.sent1: The bag was crafted from chammy.
meanings.sent2: She loved the feel of chammy against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The jacket made of chammy was the softest thing she owned.
meanings.sent4: His shoes were as smooth as chammy.
meanings.sent5: The chammy gloves kept her hands warm in winter.
